definition: a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's poem which praised the autumn chrysanthemum revealed his noble character.
sentences.chinese: 陶渊明咏秋菊的诗篇显示出他高洁的人格。

sentences.english: Psalm 25 is a cry to God for pardon of great sin.
sentences.chinese: 诗篇廿五篇是向神呼求赦免大罪的祷告。

sentences.english: I have put the first two verses of Psalm 39 on the sheet.
sentences.chinese: 在我们今天发放的传单上，前两节来自诗篇39篇。

sentences.english: For the best verse hasn't been rhymed yet.
sentences.chinese: 因为最优美的诗篇还没写成。

sentences.english: Was it because of the Quranic verses read in melodic background?
sentences.chinese: 难道是因为朗诵可兰经诗篇时有音乐伴奏吗？

sentences.english: It occurs particularly in the book of Psalms, where it's a metaphor for distress.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是在《圣经诗篇》中，代表痛苦。

sentences.english: A great poem is a fountain forever overflowing with the waters of wisdom and delight (P.B.Shelley, British poet)
sentences.chinese: 伟大的诗篇即是永远喷出智慧和欢欣之水的喷泉。

sentences.english: On grey mornings of rain I have crooned many an idle song.
sentences.chinese: 在灰暗的雨天的早晨，我吟哦过许多飘逸的诗篇。

sentences.english: You can't derange , or re-arrange, your poems again.
sentences.chinese: 你无法再弄乱，或重新整编你的诗篇。

sentences.english: Remember that? Of course that is a quotation from Psalm 22.
sentences.chinese: 还记得不？当然那是从《诗篇》第22章中引用的。

sentences.english: Psalm 102 is like a two-sided coin.
sentences.chinese: 《诗篇》第102章的内容就像一枚双面的硬币。

sentences.english: Flower-de- luce climbed all the braes one by one to overlook the visit of darkness like Psalters.
sentences.chinese: 鸢尾花渐次爬上所有的山坡，眺望黑色的诗篇降临。

sentences.english: That is a poem full of precious images .
sentences.chinese: 那是尽是挖空心思的意象的诗篇。

sentences.english: O let my looks be then the eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 哦，请让我的诗篇做我的辩士。

sentences.english: Which may be why we still cleave to his great poem.
sentences.chinese: 这或许就是我们依然坚守着他伟大诗篇的原因。

sentences.english: These two historical psalms would have been for congregational use.
sentences.chinese: 这两篇诗篇都可以用在会所中。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
